document.title: WNS2020 Gender Inclusive [Nuclear] Regulatory Body of Pakistan
document.abstract: Gender-inclusive workplace is due consideration, recognition and promotion of skills and potential of both men and women irrespective of their gender, race, ethnicity, ability and age. In Pakistan, women workforce is increasing day by day and women are also achieving higher positions at corporate level. Nevertheless, nuclear field is generally considered "male oriented". Yet, this paper aims to break the misconception and analyze gender inclusion in nuclear regulatory body of Pakistan. The paper explore contours of gender inclusion in PNRA by shedding light on female's representation in different management positions as well as in working level technical and non-technical committees. The paper study also highlights the steps PNRA management has taken over the years to ensure conducive environment for female workforce and provision of equal learning opportunity to enhance their competence.
